Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: jest
Description: A delightful JavaScript Testing Framework with a focus on simplicity

Arguments.Name: --bail
Arguments.Description: Exit the test suite immediately upon n number of failing test suite. Defaults to 1

Arguments.Name: n
Arguments.Description: n

Arguments.Name: --cache
Arguments.Description: Whether to use the cache

Arguments.Name: --no-cache
Arguments.Description: Whether to use the cache

Arguments.Name: --changedFilesWithAncestor
Arguments.Description: Runs tests related to the current changes and the changes made in the last commit

Arguments.Name: --changedSince
Arguments.Description: Runs tests related to the changes since the provided branch or commit hash

Arguments.Name: since
Arguments.Description: since

Arguments.Name: --ci
Arguments.Description: Instead of the regular behavior of storing a new snapshot automatically, will fail the test and require Jest to be run with --updateSnapshot

Arguments.Name: --clearCache
Arguments.Description: Deletes the Jest cache directory and then exits without running tests

Arguments.Name: cacheDirectory
Arguments.Description: cacheDirectory

Arguments.Name: --collectCoverageFrom
Arguments.Description: A glob pattern relative to rootDir matching the files that coverage info needs to be collected from

Arguments.Name: glob
Arguments.Description: glob

Arguments.Name: --colors
Arguments.Description: Forces test results output highlighting even if stdout is not a TTY

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: The path to a Jest config file specifying how to find and execute tests

Arguments.Name: path
Arguments.Description: path

Arguments.Name: --coverage
Arguments.Description: Enable or disable coverage, disabled by default

Arguments.Name: true|false

Arguments.Name: true

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Print debugging info about your Jest config

Arguments.Name: --detectOpenHandles
Arguments.Description: Attempt to collect and print open handles preventing Jest from exiting cleanly

Arguments.Name: --env
Arguments.Description: The test environment used for all tests

Arguments.Name: jsdom|node|path/to/env.js
Arguments.Description: jsdom|node|path/to/env.js

Arguments.Name: --errorOnDeprecated
Arguments.Description: Make calling deprecated APIs throw helpful error messages

Arguments.Name: --expand
Arguments.Description: Use this flag to show full diffs and errors instead of a patch

Arguments.Name: --findRelatedTests
Arguments.Description: Find and run the tests that cover a space separated list of source files that were passed in as arguments

Arguments.Name: <path1> ... <pathN>
Arguments.Description: <path1> ... <pathN>

Arguments.Name: --forceExit
Arguments.Description: Force Jest to exit after all tests have completed running

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show the help information

Arguments.Name: --init
Arguments.Description: Generate a basic configuration file

Arguments.Name: --injectGlobals
Arguments.Description: Insert Jest's globals (expect, test, describe, beforeEach etc.) into the global environment

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Prints the test results in JSON

Arguments.Name: --outputFile
Arguments.Description: Write test results to a file when the --json option is also specified

Arguments.Name: filename
Arguments.Description: filename

Arguments.Name: --lastCommit
Arguments.Description: Run all tests affected by file changes in the last commit made

Arguments.Name: --listTests
Arguments.Description: Lists all tests as JSON that Jest will run given the arguments, and exits

Arguments.Name: --logHeapUsage
Arguments.Description: Logs the heap usage after every test

Arguments.Name: --maxConcurrency
Arguments.Description: Prevents Jest from executing more than the specified amount of tests at the same time

Arguments.Name: num
Arguments.Description: num

Arguments.Name: --maxWorkers
Arguments.Description: Specifies the maximum number of workers the worker-pool will spawn for running tests

Arguments.Name: <num>|<string>
Arguments.Description: <num>|<string>

Arguments.Name: --noStackTrace
Arguments.Description: Disables stack trace in test results output

Arguments.Name: --notify
Arguments.Description: Activates notifications for test results

Arguments.Name: --onlyChanged
Arguments.Description: Attempts to identify which tests to run based on which files have changed in the current repository

Arguments.Name: --passWithNoTests
Arguments.Description: Allows the test suite to pass when no files are found

Arguments.Name: --projects
Arguments.Description: Run tests from one or more projects, found in the specified paths; also takes path globs

Arguments.Name: <path1> ... <pathN>
Arguments.Description: <path1> ... <pathN>

Arguments.Name: --reporters
Arguments.Description: Run tests with specified reporters

Arguments.Name: reporter
Arguments.Description: reporter

Arguments.Name: --roots
Arguments.Description: A list of paths to directories that Jest should use to search for files in

Arguments.Name: <path1> ... <pathN>
Arguments.Description: <path1> ... <pathN>

Arguments.Name: --runInBand
Arguments.Description: Run all tests serially in the current process, rather than creating a worker pool of child processes that run tests

Arguments.Name: --selectProjects
Arguments.Description: Run only the tests of the specified projects

Arguments.Name: <project1> ... <projectN>
Arguments.Description: <project1> ... <projectN>

Arguments.Name: --runTestsByPath
Arguments.Description: Run only the tests that were specified with their exact paths

Arguments.Name: --setupTestFrameworkScriptFile
Arguments.Description: The path to a module that runs some code to configure or set up the testing framework before each test

Arguments.Name: file
Arguments.Description: file

Arguments.Name: --showConfig
Arguments.Description: Print your Jest config and then exits

Arguments.Name: --silent
Arguments.Description: Prevent tests from printing messages through the console

Arguments.Name: --testNamePattern
Arguments.Description: Run only tests with a name that matches the regex

Arguments.Name: regex
Arguments.Description: regex

Arguments.Name: --testLocationInResults
Arguments.Description: Adds a location field to test results

Arguments.Name: --testPathPattern
Arguments.Description: A regexp pattern string that is matched against all tests paths before executing the test

Arguments.Name: regex
Arguments.Description: regex

Arguments.Name: --testPathIgnorePatterns
Arguments.Description: An array of regexp pattern strings that are tested against all tests paths before executing the test

Arguments.Name: [array]
Arguments.Description: [array]

Arguments.Name: --testRunner
Arguments.Description: Lets you specify a custom test runner

Arguments.Name: path
Arguments.Description: path

Arguments.Name: --testSequencer
Arguments.Description: Lets you specify a custom test sequencer

Arguments.Name: path
Arguments.Description: path

Arguments.Name: --testTimeout
Arguments.Description: Default timeout of a test in milliseconds

Arguments.Name: timeout in ms
Arguments.Description: timeout in ms

Arguments.Name: --updateSnapshot
Arguments.Description: Use this flag to re-record every snapshot that fails during this test run

Arguments.Name: --useStderr
Arguments.Description: Divert all output to stderr

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Display individual test results with the test suite hierarchy

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Print the version and exit

Arguments.Name: --watch
Arguments.Description: Watch files for changes and rerun tests related to changed files

Arguments.Name: --watchAll
Arguments.Description: Watch files for changes and rerun all tests when something changes

Arguments.Name: --watchman
Arguments.Description: Whether to use watchman for file crawling

Arguments.Name: --no-watchman
Arguments.Description: Whether to use watchman for file crawling
